column4: how do you set a static ipv6 address in /etc/network/interfaces?
iface eth0 inet6 static doesn't seem to be working
less /usr/share/doc/ifupdown/examples/network-interfaces.gz    might give you some ideas
theres no ipv6 examples in that file :(
oh.. it was much shorter than I expected..
have you checked the url to the ubuntu wiki? the one ubottu sent you
I've never used ipv6 myself so I can't really help you other than point you towards existing howto's and such
yeah the bot's link isn't that helpful either o.O
if i add the ip addr manually it works, just cant get interfaces to cooperate

bah.. one of these days I'll have to setup a virtual ipv6 network just to play with.. until then I'm sorry I can't be of more assistance.. try asking the channel again. Perhaps someone else knows more
i used an up/down hack, which is working, but probably not the correct way
hopefully they will expand the ipv6 wiki article as it gets more common
works in oneiric, doesn't work in lucid
that's odd.. I would have thought these things would look the same no matter what version
hehe.. that would just be great.. LTS release and no ipv6 =)
